etymology.description: Pictogram: a bird with a dangling tail; simplified from 鳥 based on its cursive script form.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a bird with head, body, and drooping tail. The simplified shape follows the cursive outline of 鳥, keeping the beak-and-tail silhouette while dropping extra strokes.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by adopting the cursive (grass-script) form of 鳥, reducing strokes and omitting feet and other details for a compact outline.

examples.chinese: 这只鸟在树上唱歌(這隻鳥在樹上唱歌)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhī niǎo zài shù shang chànggē.
examples.english: This bird is singing in the tree.

examples.chinese: 天气变暖时，很多鸟从南方飞来(天氣變暖時，很多鳥從南方飛來)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānqì biàn nuǎn shí, hěn duō niǎo cóng nángfāng fēi lái.
examples.english: When the weather warms up, many birds fly in from the south.
